freelance.title: Full Stack Developer
freelance.description: Small-scale freelance work and personal projects involving frontend and backend development.
freelance.details:
As a freelance developer, I worked on small web components and custom frontend features for clients, including GPT‑MA. I also pursued various personal projects to improve my skills across the full web and mobile development stack.

These experiences allowed me to deepen my understanding of component-based design, RESTful API integration, and modern development tools.
tasks: Developed a mega dropdown menu for GPT‑MA's navigation bar
Created and maintained personal portfolio and restaurant management systems
Built responsive UI components using Angular and React
Implemented backend services with Node.js and Express
Performed local testing and deployment on platforms like Vercel and Netlify

digicard.title: Mobile Developer Intern
digicard.description: Developed a mobile application for scanning and analyzing QR codes.
digicard.details:
During my internship at Digicard, I contributed to the development of a mobile application based on a detailed specifications document. The app included QR code scanning and security analysis using the VirusTotal API. I designed a clean and user-friendly interface and implemented key modules such as Favorites, History, and biometric authentication (fingerprint).

Faced with the limitation of no offline scanning, I started redesigning the app toward a hybrid architecture using Realm as a local database and a Node.js backend for data synchronization. The version 1 of the app, fully functional without offline scanning, was delivered with complete technical documentation.
tasks: Built the mobile UI using React Native (Expo)
Implemented QR code scanning and security checks via VirusTotal API
Developed Favorites and History modules using local storage (Realm)
Added fingerprint authentication for secure access
Redesigned architecture for potential offline scan support with sync logic
Wrote technical documentation for the project

gouvernancia.title: IT Intern – Web & Systems
gouvernancia.description: Explored and implemented SSH session recording solutions.
gouvernancia.details:
During my internship at Gouvernancia, I worked on setting up a system to record SSH sessions for internal monitoring. I first created a script using Asciinema to automatically start recording at session launch. However, due to format incompatibility with Apache Guacamole, I then explored and tested Guacamole by installing and configuring it multiple times.

I discovered that Guacamole natively supports SSH session recording, which only requires proper activation. This internship gave me hands-on experience with server configuration, remote access tools, and secure session monitoring.
tasks: Created a script using Asciinema to automate SSH session recording
Identified format limitations and incompatibility with Guacamole
Installed and configured Apache Guacamole for repeated testing
Explored Guacamole's built-in SSH session recording feature
Used PuTTY and SSH to test secure remote connections
Documented procedures and findings for internal use

education.licence: Bachelor's Degree in Web and Mobile Application Engineering

projects.title: My Projects
projects.subtitle: Recent
projects.description: A selection of my recent work showcasing my skills and expertise.

project1.title: Restaurant Management App (Web)
project1.description: A comprehensive web application for managing restaurant operations, migrated from a desktop version to a modern architecture.
project1.details:
This web application represents the complete migration of a desktop solution to a modern and scalable architecture. Developed with Angular for the frontend and Node.js for the backend, it enables integrated management of daily restaurant operations.

Main features:
- Secure admin interface with JWT authentication
- Real-time order management
- Table organization and reservations
- Complete inventory and stock management
- Sales tracking and detailed statistics
- Responsive interface adapted for tablet use by servers

The project required a complete architecture redesign to ensure scalability and implement an automatic update system. The MongoDB database offers significant flexibility while maintaining excellent performance even during peak periods.

project2.title: Restaurant Management App (Desktop)
project2.description: A robust desktop application for managing restaurant operations, developed with C# and SQL Server.
project2.details:
This desktop application is a complete solution for the daily management of restaurants. Developed with C# and .NET Framework, it ensures optimal performance even on modest hardware configurations.

Main features:
- Integrated POS system with ticket management
- Distinct kitchen interface with real-time notifications
- Table and reservation management
- Precise inventory tracking with restocking alerts
- Employee and schedule management
- Dashboard with financial reports and statistics

The architecture was designed to work with or without an Internet connection, with automatic data synchronization when the connection is restored. SQL Server database ensures data integrity and allows complex queries for analyzing restaurant performance.

project3.title: Pharmacy Showcase Website
project3.description: A complete showcase website for a pharmacy, presenting services, products, and facilitating customer contact.
project3.details:
This modern showcase website for a pharmacy was developed with WordPress and customized with Elementor to provide an optimal user experience. The responsive design adapts perfectly to all devices, from smartphones to large screens.

Main features:
- Presentation of pharmacy services and specialties
- Interactive catalog of featured products with filters
- Dynamic duty system and opening hours
- Contact form and preparation requests
- Integrated Google Maps location
- Online booking for specialized consultations

The site incorporates advanced SEO optimizations to improve the local visibility of the pharmacy. The customized admin interface makes it easy for non-technical staff to update content. A caching system and image optimization ensure fast loading times.

project4.title: OtakuWorld
project4.description: Community platform dedicated to manga and anime culture, developed with html , Tailwind CSS and Javascript.
project4.details:
OtakuWorld is an immersive community platform celebrating manga and anime culture. Developed with Html and styled with Tailwind CSS animated width Javascript, it offers a smooth and engaging user experience for enthusiasts.

Main features:
- Anime and manga catalog with rating system
- Personalized news feed based on preferences
- Thematic discussion forums
- Recommendation system based on preferences
- Release and event calendar
- Dark mode and interface customization

The project architecture is based on a RESTful API allowing real-time updates. Performance optimization was paramount, with the implementation of lazy loading techniques and code splitting to ensure a smooth experience even with a small content library.

project5.title: Personal Portfolio
project5.description: My personal portfolio developed with React, showcasing my projects and skills in an interactive way.
project5.details:
This portfolio represents my vision of a modern and interactive professional presentation. Developed with React and enriched with Framer Motion for animations, it highlights my journey and technical skills.

Main features:
- Responsive design adapting to all devices
- Subtle and fluid animations to enhance user experience
- Dark/light mode with smooth transition
- Multilingual support (French and English)
- Performance optimization with lazy loading
- Detailed visualization of projects and skills

The site's architecture was designed with reusable components, facilitating maintenance and future evolutions. Particular attention was paid to accessibility and performance, with optimizations for Core Web Vitals and SEO.
